total_revenue.context: Net sales increased 15% to $127.1 billion in Q3 2022, compared with $110.8 billion in Q3 2021. Excluding the $5.0 billion unfavorable impact from year-over-year changes in foreign exchange rates, net sales increased by 19% compared with Q3 2021.
total_revenue.fx_impact: Foreign exchange rates had an unfavorable impact of $5.0 billion on net sales growth.

net_sales.context: North America segment sales increased 20% year-over-year to $78.843 billion in Q3 2022.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for North America increased to $79.255 billion in Q3 2022, up 23% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: North America segment operating loss was ($0.412) billion in Q3 2022, compared with operating income of $0.880 billion in Q3 2021.

net_sales.context: International segment sales decreased 5% year-over-year to $27.720 billion in Q3 2022.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for International increased to $30.186 billion in Q3 2022, up 35% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: International segment operating loss was ($2.466) billion in Q3 2022, compared with operating loss of ($0.911) billion in Q3 2021.

net_sales.context: AWS segment sales increased 27% year-over-year to $20.538 billion in Q3 2022, or increased 28% excluding changes in foreign exchange rates.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for AWS increased to $15.135 billion in Q3 2022, up 46% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: AWS segment operating income was $5.403 billion in Q3 2022, compared with $4.193 billion in Q3 2021.

net_sales.context: Consolidated net sales increased to $127.101 billion in Q3 2022, up 15% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses increased to $124.576 billion in Q3 2022, up 19% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income decreased to $2.525 billion in Q3 2022, compared with $4.852 billion in Q3 2021.

total_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses for Q3 2022 were $124.576 billion, up 19% from $105.960 billion in Q3 2021.
key_factors: Expanded marketing and general administrative expenses

COGS.context: Cost of goods sold increased to $190 million in Q3 2022.

Fulfillment.context: Fulfillment expenses increased to $727 million in Q3 2022.

Technology_and_content.context: Technology and content expenses increased to $3.036 billion in Q3 2022.

Marketing.context: Marketing expenses increased to $1.128 billion in Q3 2022.

General_and_administrative.context: General and administrative expenses increased to $0.475 billion in Q3 2022.

Other.context: Worldwide shipping costs increased to $19.942 billion in Q3 2022.

Stock_based_Compensation.context: Total stock-based compensation expense increased to $5.556 billion in Q3 2022.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income decreased to $2.525 billion in Q3 2022, compared with $4.852 billion in Q3 2021.

net_income.context: Net income was $2.872 billion in Q3 2022, compared with $3.156 billion in Q3 2021.

eps.context: Net income of $2.872 billion translates to $0.28 per diluted share in Q3 2022, compared with $0.31 per diluted share in Q3 2021.

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow decreased to an outflow of $19.7 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with an inflow of $2.6 billion for the trailing twelve months ended September 30, 2021.

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow decreased 27% to $39.7 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with $54.7 billion for the trailing twelve months ended September 30, 2021.

free_cash_flow_less_principal_repayments.context: Free cash flow less principal repayments of finance leases and financing obligations decreased to an outflow of $28.5 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with an outflow of $8.8 billion for the trailing twelve months ended September 30, 2021.

free_cash_flow_less_equipment_and_other_.context: Free cash flow less equipment finance leases and principal repayments of all other finance leases and financing obligations decreased to an outflow of $21.5 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with an outflow of $3.9 billion for the trailing twelve months ended September 30, 2021.

capital_expenditures.context: Capital expenditures details not provided in the Q3 2022 financial results.

share_repurchase.context: Share repurchase details not provided in the Q3 2022 financial results.

daily_active_users.context: No specific user metrics provided in the Q3 2022 financial results.

monthly_active_users.context: No specific user metrics provided in the Q3 2022 financial results.

total_employees.context: Employees (full-time and part-time; excludes contractors & temporary personnel) increased to 1,544,000 in Q3 2022, up 5% year-over-year.

market_position.description: Amazon continues to lead in various sectors including e-commerce, cloud computing, digital streaming, and innovative technologies.
initiatives: Premiered several new entertainment series, including The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power, attracting over 25 million global viewers on its first day
Kicked off the inaugural season of Prime Video as the exclusive home of NFL Thursday Night Football with more than 15 million viewers for its first game
Introduced the first-ever Prime Early Access Sale, a two-day shopping event on October 11-12 exclusively for Prime members in 15 countries
Opened a dozen new fulfillment centers globally in the U.S., Mexico, Canada, Ireland, and Turkey
Expanded to Belgium with the launch of Amazon.com.be and a Prime program for local customers
Partnered with new brands and retailers to offer same-day delivery for Prime members in select ZIP codes across over 10 U.S. cities
Continued legal actions against fake review brokers, filing criminal complaints and lawsuits in Italy, Spain, and the U.S.
Rolled out Venmo as a new payment option in the U.S.
Hosted Amazon Accelerate, introducing new tools for seller success
Announced new commitments and migrations from AWS customers across various industries and geographies
Expanded AWS’s infrastructure footprint with plans to launch the AWS Asia Pacific (Bangkok) Region in Thailand and the AWS Middle East (UAE) Region
Received CrowdStrike’s 2022 Ecosystem Partner of the Year award for AWS
goals: Maintain leadership in e-commerce and cloud services
Expand technological innovations in AI, automation, and autonomous delivery systems
Enhance customer satisfaction and service offerings
Support small and medium-sized businesses
Drive innovation in health and wellness through Amazon Pharmacy and Halo
Strengthen international market presence
Enhance brand protection and anti-counterfeiting efforts
examples: Premiered The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power, attracting over 25 million viewers on its first day
Exclusive NFL Thursday Night Football coverage on Prime Video with renowned analysts
Prime Early Access Sale with over 100 million items ordered from small businesses
Opened fulfillment centers in multiple countries to enhance delivery speed
Launch of Amazon.com.be with the ‘Brands of Belgium’ storefront
Same-day delivery partnerships with brands like GNC, PacSun, and SuperDry
Legal actions against over 11,000 websites and social media groups orchestrating fake reviews
Introduction of Venmo as a payment option
Launch of new email marketing capabilities and shipping software at Amazon Accelerate
Migration of customers like BMW Group, Schwan’s Home Delivery, and Bundesliga to AWS
Launch of AWS Asia Pacific (Bangkok) Region and AWS Middle East (UAE) Region
Awarded CrowdStrike’s 2022 Ecosystem Partner of the Year for AWS

innovation.description: Amazon is focused on innovation across its platforms including AWS, Alexa, Prime Video, and new hardware devices to enhance customer experience and operational efficiency.
initiatives: Premiered new entertainment series and live sports on Prime Video
Introduced Virtual Try-On for Shoes and expanded Luxury Stores at Amazon in multiple countries
Opened Amazon Style, the first-ever physical store for apparel in Glendale, California
Deployed Just Walk Out technology at new Whole Foods Market locations and third-party retailers like T-Mobile Park and Hudson Nonstop store
Launched Amazon Marketing Stream (Beta) for real-time Sponsored Products campaign metrics
Introduced Venmo as a new payment option
Expanded AWS’s infrastructure with new regions in Thailand and UAE
Hosted the second re:MARS conference showcasing innovations like Just Walk Out Experiential Mock Store and AWS-powered Boston Dynamics’ Spot® robot
goals: Provide advanced security and database services through AWS
Enhance user interaction with Alexa
Expand digital content offerings globally
Improve smart home security solutions
Develop autonomous and cloud-based technologies
Foster customer-driven product development through innovative programs
Introduce innovative payment solutions with Amazon One and Venmo
Enhance in-vehicle entertainment and connectivity
Integrate Alexa with multiple voice assistants on single devices
Increase advertiser and agency engagement with real-time marketing insights
examples: Premiered The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power with record-breaking viewership
Exclusive NFL Thursday Night Football on Prime Video
Virtual Try-On for Shoes enhancing fashion shopping experiences
Launch of Amazon Style with personalized shopping experiences
Just Walk Out technology deployments at new locations
Amazon Marketing Stream (Beta) providing real-time campaign metrics

Launch of AWS Asia Pacific (Bangkok) Region and AWS Middle East (UAE) Region
Showcased AWS-powered Boston Dynamics’ Spot® robot at re:MARS conference

acquisitions.description: Amazon continues to grow through strategic acquisitions to enhance its product and service offerings.
initiatives: Completion of MGM acquisition, integrating MGM employees into Prime Video and Amazon Studios
Ongoing integration of acquired companies into existing platforms
Filing legal action against orchestrators of fake reviews to protect brand integrity
goals: Strengthen market position in key sectors
Enhance technological capabilities and service offerings
Accelerate growth in digital media and content
examples: Acquisition of MGM, adding over 4,000 film titles and 17,000 TV episodes to Prime Video
Integration of MGM employees into Amazon Studios to enhance content production
Legal actions against more than 11,000 websites and social media groups orchestrating fake reviews

social_initiatives.description: Amazon is committed to supporting its employees and communities, especially during challenging times.
initiatives: Investments in anti-counterfeiting efforts, identifying and disposing of over 3 million counterfeit products
Expansion of SNAP EBT usage to 48 states and Washington, D.C., allowing beneficiaries to shop at Amazon.com, Amazon Fresh, and Whole Foods Market
Creation of thousands of new jobs through the expansion of Amazon Fresh and fulfillment network
Offering industry-leading pay and benefits to employees
Launch of Amazon.pl, creating over 18,000 permanent jobs and opening the tenth fulfillment center in College Station, Texas
Support for Business Prime customers with over 140 million packages shipped free of charge
Legal actions against orchestrators of fake reviews to protect customers and brands
goals: Ensure the safety and well-being of employees
Maintain operational continuity during crises
Support communities and essential workers
Provide industry-leading pay and benefits
Foster long-term innovation and strategic growth
Expand international job creation and fulfillment capabilities
Protect customers and brands from counterfeit and fraudulent activities
examples: Spending over $700 million on anti-counterfeiting efforts, seizing and disposing of over 3 million counterfeit products
Expansion of SNAP EBT usage allowing beneficiaries in 48 states and Washington, D.C., to shop at Amazon.com, Amazon Fresh, and Whole Foods Market
Creation of over 18,000 permanent jobs through the launch of Amazon.pl and the opening of the tenth fulfillment center in College Station, Texas
Offering industry-leading pay and benefits to employees, including bonuses and healthcare
Support for Business Prime customers by shipping over 140 million packages free of charge
Legal actions against more than 11,000 websites and social media groups orchestrating fake reviews on Amazon platforms

revenue_growth.expectation: Net sales expected to be between $140.0 billion and $148.0 billion, growing 2% to 8% compared with Q4 2021.
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Excluding the unfavorable impact of approximately 460 basis points from foreign exchange rates.
factors: Continued strong performance during Prime Day and Prime Early Access Sale
Increased demand for online shopping and AWS services
Expansion of Prime Video and other subscription services
Growth in AWS infrastructure and service offerings
Launch of new services like Amazon Pharmacy and Amazon Fresh
Successful integration of Just Walk Out Technology in additional grocery stores
Innovations in shopping experiences and expansion of fulfillment network productivity
revenue_growth.specifics: Q4 2022 revenue guidance includes specific revenue and earnings expectations, assuming Prime Day occurs in the fourth quarter.

drivers: Investments in fulfillment and transportation infrastructure
Expanded marketing and general administrative expenses

core_trends: Continued investment in cloud computing and AI
Expansion of digital streaming and e-commerce platforms

leadership_transition.description: Jeff Bezos, Amazon founder and former CEO, transitioned to the role of Executive Chair in Q3 2021, and Andy Jassy became Chief Executive Officer at that time.
leadership_transition.context: Jeff Bezos stepped down to focus on long-term strategic initiatives and innovation, while Andy Jassy, head of AWS, took over as CEO to lead Amazon's continued growth.

stock_based_compensation_expense.context: Total stock-based compensation expense increased to $5.556 billion in Q3 2022.

ww_shipping_costs.context: Worldwide shipping costs increased to $19.942 billion in Q3 2022.

total_employees.context: Employees (full-time and part-time; excludes contractors & temporary personnel) increased to 1,544,000 in Q3 2022, up 5% year-over-year.

common_shares_outstanding.context: Common shares outstanding plus shares underlying stock-based awards totaled 10.6 billion on June 30, 2022, compared with 10.4 billion one year ago. All share and per share information throughout this release has been retroactively adjusted to reflect the 20-for-1 stock split effected on May 27, 2022.
